snippet: The takeover of Diabaly, a small town in central Mali, came just hours after the French foreign minister, Laurent Fabius, said his country’s intervention had blocked a rebel advance.
abstract: Islamist fighters overrun strategic village and military post in central Mali, despite intensive airstrikes by French warplanes, offering indication that war against extremists could be long and difficult one.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER, ALAN COWELL and ADAM NOSSITER
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Paris, Alan Cowell from London, and Adam Nossiter from Bamako, Mali. Elisabeth Bumiller contributed reporting from Lisbon.

lead_paragraph: The takeover of Diabaly, a small town in central Mali, came just hours after the French foreign minister, Laurent Fabius, said his country’s intervention had blocked a rebel advance.

headline.seo: After French Airstrikes, Rebels Storm Mali Village
headline.main: Malian Rebels Take Town and Vow to Avenge French Attack
headline.print_headline: After French Airstrikes, Rebels Take Over Mali Village in Counterattack

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
keywords.name: organizations
